title: Delayed Move-In Due to Work Assignment

scenario_info.name: Delayed Move-In Due to Work Assignment
scenario_info.description: Anthony purchases a home but cannot move in immediately due to a work assignment overseas that was arranged before the purchase. He moves in 8 months after purchase when his assignment ends. Because the delay was due to unforeseen work circumstances, the dwelling is treated as his main residence from the acquisition date.
applicable_rules: ATO guidance on delayed move-in: Valid exceptions include illness or work-related travel
Delay of 8 months accepted due to pre-arranged overseas work assignment
Moved in as soon as practicable (5 days after assignment ended)
Property not rented during delay = full exemption from acquisition date
Note: Renting during delay would NOT qualify for this exception

property_history.description: Property vacant - owner on pre-arranged overseas work assignment
Moved in as soon as practicable after work assignment ended (5 days after return)

properties.notes: Full main residence exemption. Delayed move-in exception applies due to pre-arranged overseas work assignment. Property treated as main residence from acquisition date.

user_query: I bought my home but couldn't move in for 8 months because I was overseas on a work assignment that was arranged before the purchase. I moved in as soon as I returned. What's my CGT situation?
